TopicTitle: Crash to Desktop after flying for a while

Articles.Content:
Greets folks!

build id = 00842

2015.05.01 at 21:02:12 CEST

Branch: master

unmodded

Win 7 64bit 8GB RAM

I tried to fly half around Kerbin for serveral times in my little airplane now, always ending up in CTD after 15-20mins(real time).

These CTD occur in mid-flight withot any special maneuvers, 2 times also shortly before attempting to land.

till now, this error had not occured. Since I read 

 GetLastError: 'FÃƒÂ¼r diesen Befehl ist nicht genÃƒÂ¼gend Speicher verfÃƒÂ¼gbar.' (which means sumthing like="not enough memory to execute this order")

reading through the output log, i presumed a lack of free RAM, though I have 8GBs RAM installed.

Already tried to cut back on texture resolution, shaders etc, these error keeps occuring.

I also tried to monitor the use of physical memory during the flight, having task manager running and watching the resource use.

I recognized a slow but gradual build-up in RAM-use up to approx 5,8GB (out of 8GB). At this point the crash seems to be reproductively occuring.

Hope this bug report is according to your requsitions, if anything is missing i'd be happy to provide additional info.

\*\*\*\* Crash! \*\*\*\*

This is probably caused by the "[New Heat System causes memory leak](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/118658-New-Heat-System-causes-memory-leak)" bug in KSP 1.0.2. Try hitting F10 to disable the part overheat gauges and see if that stops it happening...
Thx a bunch, that did it!

Hi,

I have tried pressing f10 but it keeps happening every 5-10 mins.

Is there any way to solve the crashing in the game files, the error log is the same as Eminenz010
